learning_outcomes.description: Understand and reflect critically on how Phenomenology and Existentialism are related, and what distinguishes them from other approaches to philosophy in the nineteenth, twentieth and twenty-first centuries;
Understand and analyse arguments, concepts and problems in Phenomenology and Existentialism;
Understand better the complex nature of philosophical texts in the tradition of Phenomenology and Existentialism;
Demonstrate reasoned thought, creativity, and a high quality of written expression; and
Examine, discuss and debate the main issues regarding the relevance of Phenomenology and Existentialism to our contemporary context.

assessments.task_description: Tutorials commence in the second week of semester and are assessed based on contributions as attendance alone cannot be assessed. Tutorials run from weeks 2-12 (week 4 there will be no tutorial due to the public holiday that week). The mark will be based on regular participation. Participating involves evidence of having read and tried to understood the course material, and demonstrating a willingness to contribute constructively to class discussion and debate by engaging with the contributions of others and fostering group discussion.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: Choose a question from a set provided that is related to the course material from weeks 2-9 and write a 1700 (1600-1800) word essay. Generative AI is not to be used in this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Write a 1300 (1200-1400) word essay on a question based on weeks 10-12 of the course. Generative AI is not to be used in this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial Participation

Constructive discussion in the tutorial. Tutorials will be held in Weeks 2-11.
